intro: Racosperma retinodes, commonly known as the narrow-leaf wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant typically grows as a shrub, featuring compound leaves with small, narrow leaflets. Its yellow flowers are clustered in racemes, adding ornamental value to the landscape. Racosperma retinodes is well adapted to dry conditions, making it a resilient species in arid environments.
